DECISION 5-6: Documentation Structure and Approach

After reviewing the codebase, discussion.md, project-plan.md, and the task assignment, I will create the following documentation:

## 1. API Reference (docs/api-reference.md)
- Document all HTTP endpoints from both bootstrap and Rust implementations
- Include request/response schemas with real examples
- Cover error codes and HTTP status codes
- Note that authentication is placeholder for Phase 1

## 2. Concepts Guide (docs/concepts.md)
- Simplify the philosophical foundation from discussion.md
- Explain notebook metaphor and its practical implications
- Explain integration cost/entropy model in accessible terms
- Clarify causal ordering vs timestamps
- Make it practical for developers without losing depth

## 3. Agent Integration Guide (docs/agent-integration.md)
- Focus on practical integration patterns
- Include code examples in curl, Python, and JavaScript
- Best practices for multi-agent collaboration
- Handling high-entropy periods
- Example workflows for AI agents

## 4. Quick Start (docs/quickstart.md)
- 5-minute guide to running the platform
- Create notebook, write entries, read them back
- Working code examples that can be copy-pasted
- Bootstrap server focus (what is currently running)

## Technical Decisions

1. Documentation will be based on the ACTUAL running bootstrap server API, not the future Rust implementation
2. Will include examples that work with curl for universal accessibility
3. Will cross-reference discussion.md as the foundational philosophical document
4. Will use consistent terminology across all documents
5. Will include working code examples that can be tested immediately

Proceeding with implementation.
